TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SyndicationCategory extends System.Object implements class System.ServiceModel.Syndication.ISyndicationElement

remarks.para: A category allows you to assign one or more keywords that can be used to search for information.

summary.para: A class that represents the category of a syndication feed.

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name, string scheme, string label) cil managed

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified name, scheme, and label.

Docs.param: A Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that represents the categorization scheme to which this category belongs.
A human-readable attribute that describes the category.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary<System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName,string> AttributeExtensions { get; }
.property instance class System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2<class System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName, string> AttributeExtensions

remarks.para: The syndication object model allows you to add custom attributes to a instance. Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. They are serialized as an attribute of the <category> element.

summary.para: Gets the attribute extensions for this category.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory Clone ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory Clone() cil managed

summary.para: Creates a copy of a instance.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationElementExtensionCollection ElementExtensions { get; }
.property instance class System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationElementExtensionCollection ElementExtensions

remarks.para: Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specification. You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace.

summary.para: Gets the element extensions for this category.

MemberSignature.Value: public string Label { get; set; }
.property instance string Label

remarks.para: When serialized to Atom 1.0, the is written to the label attribute of the <category> element. is not serialized to RSS 2.0.

summary.para: Gets and sets the label of the category.

MemberSignature.Value: public string Name { get; set; }
.property instance string Name

remarks.para: When serialized to Atom 1.0, the is written to the term attribute of the <category> element. is not serialized to RSS 2.0.

summary.para: Gets and sets the name of the category.

MemberSignature.Value: public string Scheme { get; set; }
.property instance string Scheme

remarks.para: When serialized to Atom 1.0, the property is written to the scheme attribute of the <category> element.
When serialized to RSS 2.0, the property is written to the domain attribute of the <category> element.

summary.para: Gets and sets the scheme of the category.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual bool TryParseAttribute (string name, string ns, string value, string version);
.method familyorassemblyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool TryParseAttribute(string name, string ns, string value, string version) cil managed

remarks.para: Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. They are serialized as an attribute of the <category> element. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the deserialization of a custom attribute extension. To do this, derive a class from and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized attribute extensions.

summary.para: Attempts to parse an attribute extension.

returns.para: A value that specifies whether the attribute extension was parsed successfully.

Docs.param: The syndication version to use when parsing.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual bool TryParseElement (System.Xml.XmlReader reader, string version);
.method familyorassemblyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool TryParseElement(class System.Xml.XmlReader reader, string version) cil managed

remarks.para: Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the deserialization of a custom element extension. To do this, derive a class from and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized attribute extensions.

summary.para: Attempts to parse an element extension.

returns.para: A value that specifies whether the element extension has been parsed successfully.

Docs.param: The syndication version to use while parsing.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void WriteAttributeExtensions (System.Xml.XmlWriter writer, string version);
.method familyorassemblyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void WriteAttributeExtensions(class System.Xml.XmlWriter writer, string version) cil managed

remarks.para: Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. They are serialized as an attribute of the <category> element. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the serialization of custom attribute extensions. To do this, derive a class from and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized attribute extensions.

summary.para: Writes the attribute extensions to the specified writer.

Docs.param: The syndication version to use while writing.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void WriteElementExtensions (System.Xml.XmlWriter writer, string version);
.method familyorassemblyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void WriteElementExtensions(class System.Xml.XmlWriter writer, string version) cil managed

remarks.para: Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specification. You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the serialization of custom element extensions. To do this, derive a class from and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized element extensions.

summary.para: Writes the element extensions to the specified writer.

Docs.param: The syndication version to use while writing.
